abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and the institutional development
            impact substantial. Several lessons were drawn from the
            project as follows. The project implementation arrangement
            was uniquely carried through the Education Secretariat in
            Minas Gerais, which proved beneficial in promoting the
            development of institutional memory, allowing a small
            project unit to perform efficiently the role of project
            coordinator unit (PCU), rather than choosing a large
            separate PCU structure. However, the absence of a monitoring
            and evaluation criteria was not fully implemented, making it
            difficult to link precise project activities to the observed
            improvements in the state's quality of education, thus
            missing an opportunity for stronger support from education
            authorities, and civil society, based on pertinent project
            data, and analysis. To this end, it is suggested to build a
            strong technical capacity in the field - through training
            and dissemination mechanisms - to guarantee the development
            of monitoring and evaluation systems. Other lessons address
            issues concerning the need a) to assess the implementing
            agencies' capacity for handling the scope of projects;
            b) to carefully consider the political environment in
            project planning; c) to integrate project financial
            management into the accounting system of the implementing
            agency; and, d) to further develop the state level student
            learning assessment by having test results amply
            disseminated to the civil society, promoting public support
            for quality education.
